item.title: About Alex Kasper
item.description:
Alex Kasper is a cybersecurity consultant, entrepreneur, and educator known as “the world’s least famous hacker.” A longtime partner and collaborator of Kevin Mitnick, Alex co-created the Certified Social Engineering Prevention Specialist (CSEPS) certification in the early 2000sâ€”the world’s first credential focused specifically on defending against social engineering attacks [?].

Background

Alex’s career spans an unusually diverse range of industries:

Cybersecurity & Social Engineering

Working alongside Kevin Mitnick beginning in the early days of the hacking scene, Alex developed deep expertise in social engineeringâ€”both offensive techniques and, more importantly, how to defend against them. This work culminated in the creation of CSEPS and ongoing training programs that help organizations recognize and resist manipulation.

Alex was featured in the documentary [Citation not found: freedom-downtime-2001], which chronicled Mitnick’s story and the broader hacking culture of the era.

Video Games

In the mid-1990s, Alex produced Return Fire for the 3DO Interactive Multiplayer at Silent Software [?]. The game became one of the system’s most acclaimed titles and was later ported to multiple platforms.

Film & Creative Industries

Alex’s creative background includes film production work, including producing Martin Starr’s first film, and various music publishing projects involving Berlin Philharmonic musicians.

Current Work

Today Alex runs multiple businesses:

  • Naturesign - A B2B SaaS platform generating regulatory documents for the flavor and fragrance industry
  • Kasper Defense - Cybersecurity training focused on social engineering prevention, built around the PSPSP framework

Alex is also writing Manufactured Urgency, a book about recognizing and defending against social engineering attacks in the modern era.

Contact

For business inquiries: alex.kasper (at) gmail.com

For verified information and citations, see the Citations page.

item.title: CSEPS
item.description:
The Certified Social Engineering Prevention Specialist (CSEPS) was the world’s first professional certification focused specifically on defending against social engineering attacks [?].

Background

Co-created by Alex Kasper and Kevin Mitnick in the early 2000s, CSEPS emerged from their combined decades of experienceâ€”Mitnick’s infamous exploits demonstrating social engineering’s power, and their joint work developing defensive countermeasures.

The Problem CSEPS Addressed

At the time, cybersecurity certifications focused almost exclusively on technical controls: firewalls, encryption, network security. But as Mitnick had demonstrated repeatedly, the weakest link in any security system is the human element.

Social engineeringâ€”manipulating people into revealing information or taking actions that compromise securityâ€”was (and remains) the most effective attack vector. Yet no formal training or certification existed to help organizations defend against it.

The Approach

CSEPS training covered:

  • Recognition - Identifying social engineering attempts across phone, email, and in-person vectors
  • Psychological principles - Understanding why social engineering works (authority, urgency, reciprocity, etc.)
  • Organizational defenses - Policies, procedures, and culture changes that reduce vulnerability
  • Incident response - What to do when an attempt is detected

Legacy

The concepts pioneered in CSEPS have since become standard in security awareness training industry-wide. The emphasis on “manufactured urgency” as a key manipulation techniqueâ€”now central to Alex’s current workâ€”originated in this early curriculum.

Related

  • [Citation not found: art-of-deception] - Kevin Mitnick’s book expanding on many CSEPS concepts
  • [Citation not found: freedom-downtime-2001] - Documentary featuring both Mitnick and Kasper

item.title: Return Fire
item.description:
Return Fire was a vehicular combat strategy game produced by Alex Kasper at Silent Software for the 3DO Interactive Multiplayer in 1995 [?].

Overview

Return Fire combined action gameplay with strategic elements, allowing players to choose between different military vehicles (jeep, tank, helicopter, armored support vehicle) to capture the enemy’s flag while defending their own base.

Reception

The game was critically acclaimed and became one of the 3DO’s most celebrated titles [?]. It was later ported to:

  • PlayStation
  • Windows PC
  • Sega Saturn

Notable Features

  • Classical music soundtrack (including Ride of the Valkyries, which became iconic to the game)
  • Split-screen multiplayer
  • Destructible environments
  • Multiple vehicle types with distinct capabilities

Legacy

Return Fire demonstrated Alex’s early career in interactive entertainment before his pivot to cybersecurity work. The game remains a cult classic among 3DO enthusiasts and is frequently cited in discussions of the console’s best titles.

item.title: Naturesign
item.description:
Naturesign is a B2B SaaS platform that automates the generation of regulatory documents for the flavor and fragrance industry.

The Problem

Companies in the flavor and fragrance industry must produce extensive regulatory documentation for every productâ€”safety data sheets, compliance certificates, ingredient declarations, and more. This documentation is:

  • Time-consuming to create manually
  • Error-prone when done by hand
  • Required by multiple regulatory bodies worldwide
  • Constantly needing updates as regulations change

The Solution

Naturesign automates this entire workflow:

  1. Data Input - Product formulations and ingredient data are entered once
  2. Document Generation - The platform automatically produces all required regulatory documents
  3. Compliance Updates - As regulations change, documents can be regenerated automatically
  4. Multi-format Output - Documents are produced in formats required by different regulatory bodies

Technology

Built on Salesforce with custom Lightning Web Components, Naturesign leverages Alex’s deep Salesforce expertise to deliver a robust, scalable solution.

Current Status

Naturesign currently serves clients in the F&F industry and is actively expanding. For more information, visit naturesign.com or contact info@naturesign.com.

item.description:
For press inquiries, contact alex@alexkasper.com.

Media Kit

Coming soon: downloadable press photos, bio, and logo assets.

Coverage

For a complete list of verified press references and citations, see the Citations page.

  • [Citation not found: freedom-downtime-2001]

  • [Citation not found: return-fire-review-nextgen]

Speaking & Appearances

Alex is available for speaking engagements on topics including:

  • Social engineering defense
  • The psychology of manipulation (“Manufactured Urgency”)
  • Cybersecurity awareness training
  • The history of hacking and social engineering

For booking inquiries, contact alex@alexkasper.com.
